chapter.title: Gathering System Information for Support
chapter.remark: taroth 2014-04-03: this chapters needs review, as some of the information may be outdated meanwhile...especially the section about submitting the information to Novell? - asked fhassels and jrecord to review this

abstract.para: In case of problems, a system report may be created using the supportconfig command. This tool will collect information about the system such as: current kernel version, hardware, installed packages, partition setup and much more. This report will help Global Technical Support to assist or locate the issue you reported. The command is provided by the package supportutils which is installed by default.

sect1.title: Overview
sect1.para: taroth 2014-04-03: what's it called nowadays? probably NSL is an outdated name... Novell Support Link (NSL) is new to &productname;. It is a tool that gathers system information and allows you to upload the collected data to another server for further analysis.
There are two ways to use Novell Support Link:

listitem.para: Use the command line utility supportconfig.

sect1.para: The &yast; Support module calls supportconfig to gather system information.

Sometimes it is easier (and quicker) to see all the relevant information when logging in a server. Install the package hostinfo on your server. Each time you log in, you will see the following information:

sect1.para: The following sections describe how to use supportconfig with &yast;, with the command line and what other options you have.

sect2.title: Using Supportconfig Directly
sect2.para: To use supportconfig from the commandline, proceed as follows:

step.para: Open a shell and become root.
Run supportconfig without any options. This gathers the default system information.
Wait for the tool to complete the operation.
The default archive location is /var/log with the filename format nts_HOST_DATE_TIME.tbz

sect1.title: Submitting Information to Novell
sect1.para: You can use the &yast; Support module or the supportconfig command line utility to submit system information to Novell. When you experience a server issue and would like Novell's assistance, you will need to open a service request and submit your server information to Novell. Both &yast; and command line methods are described.

note.para: Novell treats system reports as confidental data. Please see our privacy commitment for details at .

procedure.title: Submitting Information to Novell with YaST

step.para: Open the URL and create a service request number.
Write down your 11 digit service request number. The following examples will assume the service request number is 12345678901.
Click on Create report tarball in the &yast; Support module window.
Select the Use custom radio button. Proceed with Next.
Enter your contact information, fill in Novell 11 digit service request number and include Novell's upload target URL.
